comment: I took English Lit. He required us to read 8 novels by the end of the semester. He is one of those guys who feels his subject is the most important over all others. This must be true since everyone at SPSU goes there for an English degree. I dropped his class (so did more than half the class) because his work was too much.

Generally nice, pretty good lecturer. you will need to the required books, and it's best to read them because he will ask you about the read material. Also make sure your final presentation is interesting, otherwise he will fall asleep on you.

Writing assignments could be rigorous, especially the research paper but taking the right time to do them will minimize the stress. The A was relatively easy to obtain; a lot of grades consist of postings online (extremely easy). Take this professor if you can, he keeps discussions very interesting.

He is an excellent professor (and department Chair).  I took him for American Lit 1 and the key is to go to every class and highlight every passage he reads, do all the response papers and review the highlighted passages before test. I got an A+ and really learn somthing
